address: This is a temporary motel room program running at multiple sites in our community.
description:
Program details:
Intended for individuals who are experiencing housing insecurity who prove to be motivated to move forward in their housing journey. This could include housing, treatment date, moving, work etc
Case Management meetings are mandatory
For individuals with low or no substance use, and have no risk of overdose.
No visitors or overnight guests are permitted
Couples are accepted
Pets are accepted on a case-by-case basis
No one under the age of 19
This is a referral program only.

The program povides support services to vulnerable populations receiving rent supplements under the Canada-BC Housing Benefit (CBCHB) with the aim of strengthening their personal wellbeing and enabling them to transition to, and remain in, stable market housing.

In order to stay at the shelter, people must be willing to follow the house rules including no bullying and good neighbourliness. Amongst other things, good neighbourliness includes a willingness to participate in the upkeep and overall cleanliness of the indoor and outdoor space including the areas immediately surrounding the shelter.
eligibility: Anyone over the age of 19 who is facing barriers to housing or experiencing homelessness.
access_notes: In-person registration takes place at 1:30pm, 4:30pm, 6:30pm, 9:30pm, 11:30pm. Registration is on a first-come, first-serve basis and is dependent on bed availability.

eligibility: By referral only for individuals, including seniors, with minimal substance use and who are ready to transition to permanent housing.
access_notes: No Walk ins or Self referrals.

eligibility: By referral only for individuals, including seniors, with minimal substance use and who are ready to transition to permanent housing.
access_notes: No Walk ins or Self referrals.

description: Four Cluster Living units at The Crossings are for individuals who have specific support needs.Referrals are received from Community Living BC CLBC Vernon Office – Community Living BC
eligibility: Anyone who is over the age of 19 and is low-income, in need of affordable and supportive housing, and able to live independently. All residents must also commit to a good neighbour agreement, and be willing to be good tenants and good neighbours.

location_name: Pivot Properties,Blair Apartments,Hillside Apartments,Pioneer Place,Cedar Park
description: Turning Points manages 6 separate properties, one of which is a women’s only facility. In total these properties provide 23 individual rooms and 19 independent living bachelor units as affordable housing options in Vernon. These units provide a perfect option for individuals who are ready to transition out of supportive housing.
eligibility: Anyone who is over the age of 19 and is low-income, in need of affordable and supportive housing, and able to live independently. All residents must also commit to a good neighbour agreement, and be willing to be good tenants and good neighbours.
access_notes: Rental Application

description: Bill’s Place is a 19 bed sober living community that provides people with a safe space to embark on the path of addiction recovery.
eligibility: Anyone over the age of 19, who is seeking recovery from mood-altering chemicals or behaviours. Applicants must be willing and motivated to change, and physically and mentally stable. Residents must also be willing to follow house rules (including good neighbourliness), participate in group therapy, and donate their time to help with household activities like meal preparation.

description: Haven Place, Sober Living Program is a second stage recovery program for graduates of Turning Points’ Bill’s Place Addictions Recovery Program. This program helps participants reach a place of stability in order to get them ready for the next step in their recovery journey
eligibility: Graduates of Bill’s Place Sober Living Program who are seeking stable, interim housing, have a secure source of income, and are willing and motivated to work towards stability. Residents must also be willing to follow house rules (including good neighbourliness), participate in group therapy, and donate their time to help with household activities like meal preparation.
access_notes: Facility Hours 24/7

description: AWARE is a four-day, intensive, therapeutic program designed to assist people in becoming self-aware.  In this program, participants will learn to identify and express their emotions in a healthy way.  This program is also designed to support people who have been impacted by another person’s addiction.  Participants will leave with strategies to set healthy boundaries and have an increased sense of self-esteem.
eligibility: Anyone over the age of 19 years old.  * If you are in recovery from substance disorders, we require a minimum of 2 years sobriety.
access_notes: upcoming program dates:May 5-9th and Sept. 9-12th.

description: Teens 13 - 18 y/o

Youth Drop In Counselling offers free, confidential support for young people facing challenges like stress, anxiety, relationships, or identity. No appointment is needed, just drop in and talk to a trained counsellor in a safe, inclusive space. Sessions are focused on your immediate needs, with options for follow-up or referrals.
